subject: pedal showing disconnected
description_text:
Hello I purchased your simpson pro x pedal gas and brake. They were working
well. I recently purchased the clutch for christmas and now none of the
pedals are working. The software says disconnected and when trying to click
on anything a circle with a line through it shows up not allowing you to
click anything. So far I have tried different usb ports and uninstalled
software and also tried installing software to a different location. but
nothing works. The pedals light up but are red, not multicolor which they
were before adding clutch.

  I ordered both from amazon.The order number for the clutch is
113-8660152-7098607
and the order number for the gas and brake was 112-4912263-6879467

conversations.body_text: Hi Moblack Productions,    ProX / ProX Ultra Pedal Firmware Update Procedure:    Press and hold the Upgrade button on the control box;    Reconnect the USB cable;    The software will indicate that the device has entered “Simsonn Flasher mode”;    In the software, go to: Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-proxultra.sfu (If it’s a ProX pedal, select pedals-prox.sfu)    Start the firmware update, and once it is complete, release the Upgrade button;    Finally, retest and calibrate the pedals.

I just realized that the gas and the brake is the pro x pedals but the
clutch I purchase is the pro ultra so which firmware do I select or should
I be sending the clutch back and getting the pro x clutch instead

On Tue, Dec 30, 2025, 2:41 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Moblack Productions,  The upgrade is only related to the control box, not the pedals.

So this is weird. By accident the wire for the rgb lights from the brake
pedal to the heel plate came loose. Now all 3 pedals  are working
correctly, until I plug the rgb cable back in. They then stop working
again. They turn red and the software says disconnected. Holding down the
upgrade button and plugging them back in, still shows disconnected with
pedal light turning red not allowing for manual firmware update which is
greyed out.

  Attached is a picture of where I am plugging in the cable from the brake
to the heel plate. Can you confirm this is the correct location ?

On Tue, Dec 30, 2025 at 6:38 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Moblack Productions,  Could you please confirm whether you modified or adjusted the pedal wiring? The pedals have specific wiring requirements, and incorrect wiring may cause abnormal behavior.

No I did not but the wire from the brake came a loose from the heel plate
and not sure where to plug it in from what I see online I am plugging it in
the correct spot but when I do it stops working

On Wed, Jan 7, 2026, 10:01 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Moblack Productions,  Please provide a clear, high-resolution photo of the wiring on the back of the pedal stop LED strip, showing the full connection. I will check whether the wiring is correct.
